RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui mestrado em Fэsica pela Universitр degli Studi di Firenze (2000) e Doutorado em Fэsica pela Universitр degli Studi di Firenze (2003). Atualmente щ Professor Doutor (MS 3.1) do Instituto de Fэsica da Universidade de Sуo Paulo e Pesquisador Visitante da Comissуo Nacional de Energia Nuclear. Tem experiъncia na сrea de Fэsica, com ъnfase em Teorias Especэficas e Modelos de Interaчуo e Fэsica Nuclear, atuando principalmente nos seguintes temas: bremsstrahlung de elщtrons e induzido por prѓtons, espalhamento de elщtrons e prѓtons e desenvolvimento de instrumentaчуo.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: He has a Master in Physics from the Universitр degli Studi di Firenze (2000) and a Ph.D. in Physics from the Universitр degli Studi di Firenze (2003). PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Desde alguns anos que o LIP-Coimbra щ membro da colaboraчуo HADES, que explora um espectrѓmetro de partэculas localizado no instituto GSI, Darmstadt, Alemanha. Neste estudam-se colisѕes de iѕes pesados a energias inferiores a 2 AGev e reacчѕes elementares abaixo de 4 Gev. O envolvimento do LIP tem sido essencialmente tщcnico, com a construчуo de um grande detector (~6 metros quadrados) de tempo-de-voo baseado em ?Resistive Plate Chambers? (RPCs), que cobrirс a maior parte da regiуo dianteira do espectrѓmetro e fornecerс medidas de tempo com uma resoluчуo de 60 ps. Aproximando-se a finalizaчуo desta pesada tarefa (inicio de 2009), espera-se que o LIP se junte рs restantes instituiчѕes internacionais na partilha dos trabalhos de exploraчуo da experiъncia, tomando parte nas tomadas de dados e tomando em mуos alguns sub-tѓpicos dos principais objectivos de Fэsica (a espectroscopia de precisуo de efeitos in medio em colisѕes de iѕes pesados e reacчѕes elementares).

Neste projecto sуo pedidos fundos para participaчуo na instalaчуo do detector RPC em 2009 e para a continuaчуo do estudo de viabilidade dum sub-tѓpico de Fэsica que estс dentro das capacidades do novo detector RPC: a medida de fluxo e anti-fluxo de kaѕes em colisѕes de iѕes pesados abaixo do limiar de energia por nucleуo para produчуo de kaѕes. Esta informaчуo, equivalente р detecчуo experimental de padrѕes de movimento colectivo nos kaѕes que emergem da fase mais densa da matщria nuclear comprimida formada na colisуo, poderс revelar a presenчa dum potencial que estс ausente no vazio. Nesse caso serс evidente um impacto claro nos modelos astrofэsicos correntes do interior de estrelas de neutrѕes atravщs da possibilidade de condensaчуo de anti-kaѕes. Experimentalmente, a detecчуo do fluxo de anti-kaѕes a energias subliminares ainda estс em aberto devido р sua extrema raridade: cerca de um kaуo por cada 10000 anti-piѕes. Claramente serуo impostos requisitos exigentes no que diz respeito р resposta em tempo do detector, bem como р sua granularidade, o que vai requerer estudos cuidadosos por simulaчуo.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES:
Since several years LIP-Coimbra is contributing to the R&D phase of the upgrade of the HADES detector, located at GSI-Darmstadt and dedicated to the study of heavy ion collisions at energies below 2 AGeV and elementary reactions below 4 GeV. The involvement of LIP has been mostly technical with the construction of a large RPC wall (5 square meters), which will cover the most forward region of the spectrometer and provide time of flight information with a resolution of 60 ps. With the completion of this large task nearing (early 2009), LIP is expected to take a major role in the commissioning of the new system (2009) and subsequently to join other international institutions in shearing the load of running the experimental setup, by taking part into beamtimes and by leading the scientific investigation into physics subtopics of the main goals (i.e. the precision spectroscopy of in medio effects in heavy ion and elementary collisions).

In this project support is requested for the upcoming commissioning beamtimes and the continuation of a feasibility study of a physics subtopic within the potential capabilities of the wall: the measurement of kaon and anti-kaon flow in heavy ion collisions below the threshold energy per nucleon for kaon production in nucleon-nucleon collisions. This information, equivalent to the experimental detection of a collective motion pattern of the kaons leaving the most dense phase of compressed nuclear matter formed in the collision, could reveal the presence of a potential different from the one in the vacuum. A clear impact on current astrophysical models of neutron star interiors is apparent through the possibility of anti-kaon condensation. Experimentally, the detection of anti-kaon flow at subthreshold energies is still open due to their extreme rarity: about one per 10000 anti-pions. Clearly, stringent requirements on the apparatus time response as well as granularity are imposed and demand a careful simulation study.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES:
Since several years LIP-Coimbra is contributing to the R&D phase of the upgrade of the HADES detector, located at GSI-Darmstadt and dedicated to the study of heavy ion collisions at energies below 2 AGeV and elementary reactions below 4 GeV. The involvement of LIP has been mostly technical with the construction of a large RPC wall (5 square meters), which will cover the most forward region of the spectrometer and provide time of flight information with a resolution of 60 ps. With the completion of this large task nearing (end 2008), LIP is expected to join the other international institutions in sharing the load of running the experimental setup, by taking part into beamtimes and by leading the scientific investigation into physics subtopics of the main goals (i.e. the precision spectroscopy of in medio effects in heavy ion and elementary collisions).

In this project support is requested for the upcoming beamtimes and the completion of a feasibility study of a physics subtopic within the potential capabilities of the wall: the measurement of kaon and anti-kaon flow in heavy ion collisions below the threshold energy per nucleon for kaon production in nucleon-nucleon collisions. This information, equivalent to the experimental detection of a collective motion pattern of the kaons leaving the most dense phase of compressed nuclear matter
formed in the collision, could reveal the presence of a potential absent in the vacuum. A clear impact on current astrophysical models of neutron star interiors is apparent through the possibility of anti-kaon condensation. Experimentally, the detection of anti-kaon flow at subthreshold energies is still open due to their extreme rarity: about one per 10000 anti-pions. Clearly, stringent requirements on the apparatus time response as well as granularity are imposed and require a careful
simulation study.

Finally, in the present project it is included a small subpart of the construction task, namely the development of a temperature control system for the RPC wall, aiming at improving its counting rate capability.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: PTDC/FIS/67002/2006: ?Feasibility study of using Compton scattering for medical imaging with positrons?
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
A tomografia por emissуo de positrѕes (PET) щ uma poderosa tщcnica de imagiologia molecular utilizada no diagnѓstico mщdico e tambщm na investigaчуo biomщdica e farmacъutica. Do ponto de vista instrumental, o desafio щ detectar os pares de fotѕes gama de 511 keV emitidos na mesma direcчуo e em sentidos opostos na sequъncia da aniquilaчуo do positrуo com um electrуo do meio. Se ambos os fotѕes saem da fonte sem interagir com ela e se, ainda, cada um produz uma њnica interacчуo no detector, a recta que une estes dois pontos de interacчуo (linha de resposta) passa necessariamente pelo ponto de aniquilaчуo. Adquirindo um grande nњmero das linhas de resposta pode assim reconstruir-se a posiчуo da fonte de positrѕes. No entanto, se um dos fotѕes (ou ambos) sofre(m) dispersуo no meio detector, a linha de resposta nуo fica bem definida. Os eventos deste tipo sуo normalmente eliminados para nуo deteriorarem a imagem.
Este projecto pretende estudar a possibilidade de usar os eventos com dispersуo Compton no detector para extrair a informaчуo que possa ser usada na reconstruчуo da imagem. Isto requer que o detector seja capaz de detectar e resolver interacчѕes mњltiplas. Ora existem poucos detectores com tal capacidade. O protѓtipo do detector de xщnon lэquido desenvolvido no nosso laboratѓrio para PET, satisfaz os requisitos necessсrios para alcanчar esse objectivo. Neste detector, a cintilaчуo do xщnon щ utilizada para coincidъncias rсpidas e, ao mesmo tempo, o sinal de carga permite determinar as posiчѕes dos pontos de interacчуo em 3D com uma elevada precisуo. Estс planeado explorar a possibilidade de utilizar este detector (ou um semelhante) para os fins mencionados e avaliar o impacto dos eventos com dispersуo no detector na imagem obtida. O estudo serс feito por meios computacionais e consiste em trъs partes: simulaчуo das interacчѕes dos fotѕes gama com o anel de detectores pelo mщtodo Monte Carlo; identificaчуo das sequъncias de interacчѕes; e construчуo das linhas de resposta e reconstruчуo da imagem. Esta imagem deve ser depois comparada com a obtida apenas a partir dos eventos com interacчуo fotoelщctrica.
Щ sabido que os dois fotѕes resultantes de uma aniquilaчуo tъm orientaчѕes ortogonais do vector do campo elщctrico. A dispersуo Compton, por sua vez, щ sensэvel р polarizaчуo do fotуo incidente. Portanto, a identificaчуo correcta das sequъncias das interacчѕes para cada um dos dois fotѕes fornece a informaчуo sobre o estado de polarizaчуo deste par de fotѕes e permite estabelecer constrangimentos adicionais que podem ajudar de reduzir o nњmero de contagens do fundo devidas a dispersуo no corpo e a coincidъncias fortuitas. No entanto, a dependъncia angular da secчуo eficaz para a dispersуo Compton pode tornar-se menos acentuada se o fotуo interagir com um electrуo ligado, como acontece num meio real. Portanto, щ a nossa intenчуo estudar este efeito, para o xщnon em particular, utilizando os mщtodos de simulaчуo Monte Carlo e pacotes de software adequado.
A reconstruчуo das sequъncias de interacчѕes resultantes da dispersуo Compton faz-se numa base estatэstica e depende fortemente das propriedades do detector. Num detector de xщnon lэquido com leitura em carga, a forma do sinal щ sensэvel, em princэpio, р orientaчуo do traчo do electrуo de recuo em relaчуo aos elщctrodos. Por outro lado, a conservaчуo do momento exige que o electrуo seja emitido no plano definido pelo fotуo incidente e pelo espalhado e, ainda, com certo тngulo em relaчуo destes. Portanto, se o detector puder fornecer alguma informaчуo adicional acerca da orientaчуo, tal deve ser њtil para validar a verdadeira sequъncia das interacчѕes e, eventualmente, conhecer a polarizaчуo do fotуo. Pretendemos, fazer uma experiъncia que tentarс medir a orientaчуo do traчo do electrуo libertado, construindo para tal uma cтmara de xщnon (ou сrgon) em que isso seja viсvel.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES:
Positron Emission Tomography (PET) is a powerful molecular imaging technique widely used for medical diagnostic, as well as for biomedical and pharmaceutical research. From the instrumental point of view, the challenge is to detect a pair of 511 keV gamma-rays, produced in a positron- electron annihilation event and emitted in the opposite directions. If both gamma-rays emerge from the source without interaction with it and produce single interactions in the detection system, a straight line (line of response) can be defined, necessarily passing through the annihilation point. Acquiring a large number of lines of response, the source position can be reconstructed. However, if one or both photons are scattered in the detector, the line of response is not well defined and such events are usually removed from the data.
The proposed project intends to study the possibility of using gamma-rays, scattered in the detection medium, to extract useful information for the image reconstruction instead of rejecting them. This requires from the detector a capability of multihit resolution ? a very demanding requisite, which very few detectors can fulfil. The liquid xenon prototype, developed in our laboratory for PET suits very well for this task. In this detector, scintillation of the liquid is used for fast coincidences while the ionisation signal provides precise 3D localization of each interaction point. We plan, therefore, to explore the possibility of using this or similar detector for the above purpose and to evaluate the impact on the PET image of inclusion of scattered events into the input data for the image reconstruction. The study will be carried out by computation and consist in three parts: Monte Carlo simulation of interactions of 511 keV gamma-rays with the ring of detectors, identification of the Compton sequences and, finally, building the lines of response and reconstruction of the PET image. This image will be compared with that obtained from single interaction data, only.
The two annihilation photons are known to have orthogonal orientations of the electric field vector. The Compton scattering process, in turn, is sensitive to photon polarization. Thus, by identifying the scattering sequences one can get information on the polarization of a pair of detected photons and to set additional constrains to reduce background counts due to scattering in the object and random coincidences. However, the angular dependence of the scattering cross section can be smeared out if the scattering occurs on bounded electrons, as it is the case of a real medium. Therefore, we intend to study the strength of this correlation, for xenon in particular, by Monte Carlo simulation using adequate software packages.
The reconstruction of Compton sequences is usually done on statistical basis and depends critically on the detector characteristics. In the liquid xenon detector with ionisation readout, the shape of the ionisation signal is sensitive, in principle, to orientation of the track of the Compton electron with respect to the readout system. On the other hand, momentum conservation requires the electron to emerge in the plane defined by the incident and the scattered photons and at certain angle. Therefore, if detector would be capable to provide some information on the electron track orientation it can provide valuable information on the true interaction sequence and photon polarization. We intend to set up an experiment in order to attempt to measure the track orientation with a specially built xenon (or argon) chamber.
 The results, that are expected to obtain in the framework on the proposed project, will give some insight on the relevance of Compton scattered events for PET imaging.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Desde alguns anos que o LIP-Coimbra щ membro da colaboraчуo HADES, que explora um espectrѓmetro de partэculas localizado no instituto GSI, Darmstadt, Alemanha. Neste estudam-se colisѕes de iѕes pesados a energias inferiores a 2 AGev e reacчѕes elementares abaixo de 4 Gev. O envolvimento do LIP tem sido essencialmente tщcnico, com a construчуo de um grande detector (~8 metros quadrados) de tempo-de-voo baseado em "Resistive Plate Chambers" (RPCs), que cobrirс a maior parte da regiуo dianteira do espectrѓmetro e fornecerс medidas de tempo com uma resoluчуo de 60 ps. Encontrando-se finalizada esta pesada tarefa, espera-se que o LIP se junte рs restantes instituiчѕes internacionais na partilha dos trabalhos de exploraчуo da experiъncia, tomando parte nas tomadas de dados e tomando em mуos alguns sub-tѓpicos dos principais objectivos de Fэsica (a espectroscopia de precisуo de efeitos in medio em colisѕes de iѕes pesados e reacчѕes elementares).

Neste projecto sуo pedidos fundos para participaчуo na instalaчуo do detector RPC em 2009 e para a continuaчуo do estudo de viabilidade dum sub-tѓpico de Fэsica que estс dentro das capacidades do novo detector RPC: a medida de fluxo e anti-fluxo de kaѕes em colisѕes de iѕes pesados abaixo do limiar de energia por nucleуo para produчуo de kaѕes. Esta informaчуo, equivalente р detecчуo experimental de padrѕes de movimento colectivo nos kaѕes que emergem da fase mais densa da matщria nuclear comprimida formada na colisуo, poderс revelar a presenчa dum potencial que estс ausente no vazio. Nesse caso serс evidente um impacto claro nos modelos astrofэsicos correntes do interior de estrelas
de neutrѕes atravщs da possibilidade de condensaчуo de anti-kaѕes. Experimentalmente, a detecчуo do fluxo de anti-kaѕes a energias subliminares ainda estс em aberto devido р sua extrema raridade: cerca de um kaуo por cada 10000 anti-piѕes. Claramente serуo impostos requisitos exigentes no que diz respeito р resposta em tempo do detector, bem como р sua granularidade, o que vai requerer estudos
cuidadosos por simulaчуo.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES:
Since several years LIP-Coimbra is contributing to the R&D phase of the upgrade of the HADES detector, located at GSI-Darmstadt and dedicated to the study of heavy ion collisions at energies below 2 AGeV and elementary reactions below 4 GeV. The involvement of LIP has been mostly technical with the construction of a large RPC wall (5 square meters), which will cover the most forward region of the spectrometer and provide time of flight information with a resolution of 60 ps. With the completion of this large task, LIP is expected to take a major role in the commissioning
of the new system (2009-2010) and subsequently to join other international institutions in sharing the load of running the experimental setup, by taking part into beamtimes and by leading the scientific investigation into physics subtopics of the main goals (i.e. the precision spectroscopy of in
medio effects in heavy ion and elementary collisions).

In this project support is requested for the upcoming commissioning beamtimes and the continuation of a feasibility study of a physics subtopic within the potential capabilities of the wall: the measurement of kaon and anti-kaon flow in heavy ion collisions below the threshold energy per nucleon for kaon production in nucleon-nucleon collisions. This information, equivalent to the experimental detection of a collective motion pattern of the kaons leaving the most dense phase of compressed nuclear matter formed in the collision, could reveal the presence of a potential different from the one in vacuo. A clear impact on current astrophysical models of neutron star interiors is apparent through the possibility of anti-kaon condensation. Experimentally, the detection of anti-kaon flow at sub-threshold energies is still open due to their extreme rarity: about one per 10000 anti-pions. Clearly, stringent requirements on the apparatus time response as well as granularity are imposed and demand a careful
simulation study.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Medidas do Primeiro Coeficiente Townsend de Ionizaчуo e de Velocidade de Arrastamento de Elщtrons em Misturas Gasosas
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Este projeto contempla medidas do primeiro coeficiente Townsend de ionizaчуo e de velocidades de arrastamento de elщtrons em misturas de gases freqќentemente utilizados como inibidores de descargas, em regiѕes de elevados campos elщtricos. O mщtodo proposto baseia-se na tщcnica pulsada de Townsend, onde o movimento de elщtrons liberados de um catodo metсlico pela incidъncia de um feixe de laser de N2 e acelerados em um campo elщtrico uniforme щ responsсvel pela geraчуo de um sinal elщtrico de curta duraчуo. Este projeto serс realizdo em colaboraчуo com o Laboratѓrio de Instrumentaчуo e Fэsica Experimental de Partэculas (LIP) do Departamento de Fэsica da Universidade de Coimbra, Portugal.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: FAPESP/2002/04697-1: "Medidas de parтmetros de transporte de elщtrons em gases sob campos elщtricos elevados"
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O projeto proposto contempla medidas dos parтmetros de transporte de elщtrons em misturas gasosas adequadas р operaчуo de detectores gasosos de partэculas elementares em regime de avalanche para campos elщtricos muito elevados, atщ agora experimentalmente inacessэveis. A determinaчуo experimental destes parтmetros, nomeadamente a velocidade de deriva e o coeficiente efetivo de multiplicaчуo, em funчуo do campo elщtrico reduzido (campo elщtrico por unidade de pressуo), fornecerс dados bсsicos para a melhor compreensуo dos processos fэsicos envolvidos na operaчуo de detectores gasosos e subsэdios para a otimizaчуo do projeto e construчуo destes detectores atravщs de simulaчѕes, frequentemente baseadas no mщtodo de Monte Carlo, de suas respostas рs radiaчѕes. Este projeto serс realizdo em colaboraчуo com o Laboratѓrio de Instrumentaчуo e Fэsica Experimental de Partэculas (LIP) do Departamento de Fэsica da Universidade de Coimbra, Portugal.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Desenvolvimento de Cтmaras Resistivas de Placas Paralelas
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
As atividades que se pretende realizar estуo relacionadas com o desenvolvimento de Cтmaras Resistivas de Placas Paralelas com espaчamentos inferiores a 1200 μm (thin gaps RPCs) com a colaboraчуo do Laboratѓrio de Instrumentaчуo e Fэsica Experimental de Partэculas (LIP) do Departamento de Fэsica da Universidade de Coimbra, Portugal.
Em particular, estaremos interessados em estudar a influъncia da carga espacial gerada em condiчѕes de campos elщtricos elevados na resoluчуo temporal obtida com esses detectores empregando diferentes misturas gasosas. Para tanto, o projeto proposto contempla medidas dos sinais gerados pela incidъncia da radiaчуo de um feixe de laser de nitrogъnio na RPC em funчуo da distтncia entre as placas e da tensуo de polarizaчуo. A partir desses dados pretende-se determinar parтmetros fundamentais relacionados ao funcionamento dos detectores resistivos em regime de avalanche, nomeadamente: o coeficiente efetivo de multiplicaчуo em carga (α*), a velocidade de arrastamento dos elщtrons (v) em funчуo do campo elщtrico reduzido (campo elщtrico por unidade de pressуo), a extraчуo de sinais rсpidos de carga, a carga total desenvolvida nas avalanches e ainda a forma do sinal iєnico associado a esses processos. 
A determinaчуo experimental destes parтmetros fornecerс dados bсsicos para a melhor compreensуo dos processos fэsicos envolvidos na operaчуo de RPCs, bem como das limitaчѕes impostas pelos efeitos de carga espacial na aplicaчуo desses detectores em medidas de tempo de vєo (TOF).
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Desenvolvimento de Cтmaras Resistivas de Placas Paralelas

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Interaчуo da radiaчуo com a matщria ? baixas energias

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: FAPESP/JP/2016/13116-5: "Medidas sistemсticas do Espalhamento Mњltiplo de Elщtrons e Prѓtons com energias atщ 5 MeV"
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O presente projeto visa fornecer dados de referъncia sobre espalhamento elсstico mњltiplo de elщtrons e prѓtons com uma quantificaчуo rigorosa das incertezas estatэsticas e sistemсticas. Os feixes de elщtrons do Laboratѓrio do Acelerador Linear (LAL) (energias variсveis com continuidade entre 10 keV e 100 keV e de 1.9 MeV e 5.0 MeV) e de prѓtons do Laboratѓrio de Anсlise de Materiais por Feixes Iєnicos (LAMFI) (energias variсveis com continuidade entre 800 keV e 4.0 MeV) serуo usados. Esse assunto щ fundamental para muitas aplicaчѕes desde a determinaчуo de perfis de concentraчуo usando feixes iєnicos atщ a localizaчуo da dose em radioterapia e a resoluчуo em momento de detectores de partэculas de tipo "tracking". Infelizmente, os dados experimentais existentes sуo muito antigos e sem uma quantificaчуo rigorosa das incertezas sistemсticas. Dados recentes nуo foram medidos em condiчѕes bem controladas. Uma das contribuiчѕes importantes ao presente projeto serс uma quantificaчуo rigorosa de: i) espessura do alvo, ii) contaminaчуo do alvo e iii) nуo uniformidade do alvo. Um conjunto extenso de combinaчѕes de Z-energia das partэculas-espessura do alvo serс coletado procurando as condiчѕes mais sensэveis para diferenciar entre vсrias abordagens teѓricas e implementaчѕes Monte Carlo. Os benefэcios de longo prazo serуo a implantaчуo de uma competъncia sobre espetroscopia de elщtrons no LAL e a constituiчуo de uma colaboraчуo permanente entre LAL e LAMFI com o objetivo de alcanчar uma descriчуo consistente da interaчуo de elщtrons e prѓtons com a matщria em outros processos alщm do espalhamento mњltiplo.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: The goal of the present project is to collect a reference set of measurements of electron and proton multiple elastic scattering with rigorous quantification of the statistical and systematic uncertainties. The electron and proton beams available at the Laboratѓrio do Acelerador Linear (LAL) (energies continuously variable from 10 keV to 100 keV, and of 1.9 MeV and 5.0 MeV) and at the Laboratѓrio de Anсlise de Materiais por Feixes Iєnicos (LAMFI) (energies continuously variable from 800 keV to 4.0 MeV), respectively, will be used for the measurements. This is a fundamental issue for several applications ranging from depth profiling in ion beam analysis to absorbed dose localisation in radiation therapy and momentum resolution of tracking detectors in particle physics. Unfortunately, almost all existing experimental data are rather old and lack a complete quantification of the systematic uncertainties. Recent data were not measured under well controlled conditions. A key ingredient of the present project will be a careful characterisation of: i) target thickness, ii) target contamination and iii) target non uniformity. An extensive range of Z-particle energy-target thickness combinations will be covered searching for the most sensitive conditions to discriminate between different theoretical approaches and Monte Carlo implementations. Long-term benefits include the implantation of a competence on electron spectroscopy at LAL and the setup of a long term cooperation between LAL and LAMFI with the goal to achieve a consistent description of the interaction of electrons and protons with matter for other processes beyond multiple scattering.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: FAPESP/JP/2016/13116-5: "Systematic measurements of Electron and Proton Multiple Scattering with energies up to 5 MeV"

FINANCIADOR-DO-PROJETO.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Fundaчуo de Amparo р Pesquisa do Estado de Sуo Paulo

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: FAPESP/2015/14530-7: "Ionizaчуo de camadas atєmicas internas por impacto de elщtrons com energias de 10 keV a 5 MEV no microtron de Sуo Paulo"
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Propomos medir a seчуo de choque de ionizaчуo por impacto de elщtrons das camadas internas de сtomos de elementos distribuэdos pela tabela periѓdica, pela importтncia teѓrica e prсtica do fenєmeno. O feixe de elщtrons, com energia entre 10 keV e 5 MeV, serс fornecido por uma das trъs linhas de feixe do Microtron de Sуo Paulo. A seчуo de choque serс deduzida a partir da mediчуo da taxa de produчуo de raios-X de fluorescъncia com detetores de estado sѓlido. Os alvos finos e sua caracterizaчуo serуo
obtidos em colaboraчуo com outros Laboratѓrios do Instituto de Fэsica da USP e os padrѕes de calibraчуo de intensidade de raios-X com o Laboratѓrio de Metrologia Nuclear do IPEN-CNEN/SP. A seчуo de choque de ionizaчуo щ um dos parтmetros fundamentais na quantificaчуo dos fenєmenos de interaчуo de elщtrons e raios-X com a matщria e necessсrio nas simulaчѕes do transporte de fѓtons e elщtrons. Com os recursos
solicitados neste projeto, montaremos um arranjo experimental e desenvolveremos mщtodos de anсlise que permitirуo obter resultados com precisуo relativa da ordem de 5%. A fim de calibrar acuradamente a eficiъncia de detecчуo de raios-X entre 3 e 10 keV, determinaremos sua intensidade de emissуo no decaimento de radioisѓtopos que possam ser adotados como padrѕes. Mediremos tambщm a distribuiчуo angular dos raios-X L em elementos de nњmero atєmico elevado, com a expectativa de verificar se
as vacтncias na camada L3 produzidas por impacto de elщtrons estуo alinhadas com a quantidade de movimento da partэcula incidente. Esses resultados experimentais permitirуo reavaliar as aproximaчѕes usadas nos melhores cсlculos teѓricos existentes.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES:
We propose to measure atomic inner shell ionization cross sections by electron impact of elements scattered over the periodic table, because of the theoretical and practical importance of the phenomenon. One of the three experimental lines of the Sao Paulo Microtron will provide the electron beam, with energy between 10 keV and 5 MeV. The cross-section is deduced from the characteristic x-ray production rate measured with solid-state detectors. Thin targets and their characterization will be obtained in collaboration with other laboratories of USP's Institute of Physics. The calibration standards of x-ray intensity will be developed in collaboration with the Nuclear Metrology Laboratory of IPEN-CNEN / SP. The ionization cross sections are key parameters in the measurement of electron and x -rays interaction phenomena with matter and are required in the simulations of photons and electrons transport. With the
funds requested in this project, we will set up an experimental arrangement and develop methods of analysis that will allow obtaining results with relative precision of about 5%. In order to calibrate efficiency accurately, we will determine the emission intensity of x-rays in the decay of radioisotopes that can be adopted as efficiency calibration standards between 3 and 10 keV. We will also measure the angular distribution of the L x-rays in elements of high atomic number, and verify whether the L3 shell vacancies
generated by electron impact are aligned with the incident particle momentum. The experimental results will provide strict tests of the theoretical calculations.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: FAPESP/2015/14530-7: "Ionizaчуo de camadas atєmicas internas por impacto de elщtrons com energias de 10 keV a 5 MEV no microtron de Sуo Paulo"

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In this work studies of the first Townsend coefficient (alpha) behavior in isobutane for reduced electric fields ranging from 139Td up to 208Td are presented. Pure isobutane has been widely used in Resistive Plate Chambers (RPCs) and other gaseous detectors because of its excellent timing properties. Regardless of these characteristics, there is a lack of swarm parameters data in the literature for this gas. The measurements were based on the Pulsed Townsend technique. Considering the ratio between the current, measured in avalanche mode, and the primary ionization current, the first Townsend coefficient can be determined. In order to validate the technique, results for nitrogen are also presented.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: In this work studies of the first Townsend coefficient (alpha) behavior in isobutane for reduced electric fields ranging from 139Td up to 208Td are presented. Regardless of these characteristics, there is a lack of swarm parameters data in the literature for this gas. The measurements were based on the Pulsed Townsend technique. Considering the ratio between the current, measured in avalanche mode, and the primary ionization current, the first Townsend coefficient can be determined. In order to validate the technique, results for nitrogen are also presented.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In the present work we report on the preliminary results related to the dependence of the electron drift velocity for isobutane as function of the reduced electric field E/N in the range of 190 Td up to 211 Td. The employed method is based on the Pulsed Townsend technique. In our configuration the anode is of a high resistivity (2.10(10) (sic).m) glass, while the cathode is made of aluminum. In order to validate the technique, the initial measurements were carried out for nitrogen, which is a gas widely studied.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: HADRON 2009: Proceedings of the XIII International Conference on Hadron Spectroscopy

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The HADES spectrometer installed at GSI Darmstadt is a second generation experiment to study production of lepton pairs from proton, pion and nucleus induced reactions at the SIS/BEVALAC energy regime. The HADES study of the light C+C system at 1 and 2 AGeV confirms former finding of the DLS collaboration. Further studies of the reaction p+p and d+p allowed to reveal contribution to the above mentioned data of di-leptons produced during first chance collision. Finally, the results of the study of heavier system Ar+KCl indicates possible nonlinear dependence of the observed excess over the known long lived sources of di-leptons on the number of participants.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The HADES spectrometer installed at GSI Darmstadt is a second generation experiment to study production of lepton pairs from proton, pion and nucleus induced reactions at the SIS/BEVALAC energy regime. The HADES study of the light C+C system at 1 and 2 AGeV confirms former finding of the DLS collaboration. Further studies of the reaction p+p and d+p allowed to reveal contribution to the above mentioned data of di-leptons produced during first chance collision. Finally, the results of the study of heavier system Ar+KCl indicates possible nonlinear dependence of the observed excess over the known long lived sources of di-leptons on the number of participants.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XXXIII BRAZILIAN WORKSHOP ON NUCLEAR PHYSICS

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Processos de Colisуo e Interaчѕes de Сtomos e Molщculas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: To aid the data analysis of pulsed Townsend experiments, a special code has been developed to calculate the induced pulse by solving the electron continuity equation including growth, drift and diffusion. A realistic profile of the initial laser beam is taken into account as well as the boundary conditions at the cathode and the anode. The approach is either semi-analytic, based on the expression derived by P. H. Purdie and J. Fletcher, or fully numerical, using a finite-difference scheme introduced by J. de Urquijo et al. A new improved scheme is also proposed and compared with the other two methods under typical experimental conditions. A brief discussion on the stability of the numerical procedures is given. The new finite-difference scheme allows a detailed investigation of the importance of back diffusion to the cathode, a subject seldom tackled in the past.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: To aid the data analysis of pulsed Townsend experiments, a special code has been developed to calculate the induced pulse by solving the electron continuity equation including growth, drift and diffusion. A realistic profile of the initial laser beam is taken into account as well as the boundary conditions at the cathode and the anode. The approach is either semi-analytic, based on the expression derived by P. H. Purdie and J. Fletcher, or fully numerical, using a finite-difference scheme introduced by J. de Urquijo et al. A new improved scheme is also proposed and compared with the other two methods under typical experimental conditions. A brief discussion on the stability of the numerical procedures is given. The new finite-difference scheme allows a detailed investigation of the importance of back diffusion to the cathode, a subject seldom tackled in the past.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: NUCLEAR PHYSICS 2008: XXXI Workshop on Nuclear Physics in Brazil

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Beyond the general interest for nuclear matter theory, the K(-) in medio mass modification could have important astrophysical consequences. Experimental evidences of how a nuclear medium affects K(+) and K(-) properties will be summarised. To reach a firm conclusion about the K(-), the missing information on the flow will be shown to be still relevant.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XII Meeting on Nuclear Applications - International Nuclear Atlantic Conference - INAC 2015

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Mщtodos Experimentais e Instrumentaчуo para Partэculas Elementares e Fэsica Nuclear

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
In our previous works, measurements of the first Townsend ionization coefficient, α, for pure nitrogen and
isobutane at atmospheric pressure as a function of the reduced electric field were carried out in the range of 145 to 194 Td to prevent the chamber from electrical discharges. In order to increase this upper limit, the setup was modified for operating at low pressure. The detector has a Resistive Plate Chamber-like configuration where the primary ionization is produced by the incidence of nitrogen pulsed laser beam on an aluminum electrode. To validate the technique, measurements of the first Townsend ionization coefficient in nitrogen as a function of the reduced electric field were carried out at atmospheric pressure and at 100hPa, as this is an extensively studied gas with well-established data. Good agreement among our results, data from the literature and Magboltz simulations, leading us to extend our method to Tissue Equivalent (TE) gases whose α is unknown. Preliminary measurements of α in a methane-based TE gas (CH4 - 64.4%, CO2 - 32.4% and N2 - 3.2%) are also presented.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
In our previous works, measurements of the first Townsend ionization coefficient, α, for pure nitrogen and
isobutane at atmospheric pressure as a function of the reduced electric field were carried out in the range of 145 to 194 Td to prevent the chamber from electrical discharges. In order to increase this upper limit, the setup was modified for operating at low pressure. The detector has a Resistive Plate Chamber-like configuration where the primary ionization is produced by the incidence of nitrogen pulsed laser beam on an aluminum electrode. To validate the technique, measurements of the first Townsend ionization coefficient in nitrogen as a function of the reduced electric field were carried out at atmospheric pressure and at 100hPa, as this is an extensively studied gas with well-established data. Good agreement among our results, data from the literature and Magboltz simulations, leading us to extend our method to Tissue Equivalent (TE) gases whose α is unknown. Preliminary measurements of α in a methane-based TE gas (CH4 - 64.4%, CO2 - 32.4% and N2 - 3.2%) are also presented.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Effect of the ohmic drop in a RPC-like chamber for measurement of electron transport parameters
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Effect of the ohmic drop in a RPC-like chamber for measurement of electron transport parameters

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XIII Meeting on Nuclear Applications - International Nuclear Atlantic Conference - INAC 2017

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Mщtodos Experimentais e Instrumentaчуo para Partэculas Elementares e Fэsica Nuclear

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The main advantage of Resistive Plate Chambers (RPCs), applied, for instance, in High-Energy Experiments and Positron Emission Tomography (PET), is that it is spark-protected due to the presence of, at least, one high-resistive electrode. However, the ohmic drop across the latter can affect the charge multiplication significantly. In this work, we investigate this effect in a RPC-like chamber. The counter was filled with nitrogen at atmospheric pressure and the primary ionization was produced by the incidence of nitrogen pulsed laser beam on an aluminum cathode. The illumination area of the cathode was measured using a foil of millimetric paper overlaid on this electrode. In this way, the resistance of the glass anode could be estimated using the known resistivity of the glass (ρ=2з1012 Ω.cm). Therefore, the voltage drop across the dielectric was calculated by the product of the current across the gas gap and the anode resistance. In order to mitigate the effect of the resistive electrode, the laser beam intensity was limited by interposing metallic meshes between the laser and the chamber window. The dependence of the ohmic drop from the applied voltage was analyzed. The results obtained shown that, without the meshes, the ohmic drop corresponds up to 7% of the applied voltage, preventing the detection system to reach values of density normalized electric fields in the gas gap (Eeff/N) higher than 166 Td. By minimizing the laser beam intensity and, consequently, the primary ionization, the ohmic drop represented only 0.2% of the applied voltage, extending the Eeff /N range up to 175 Td.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The main advantage of Resistive Plate Chambers (RPCs), applied, for instance, in High-Energy Experiments and Positron Emission Tomography (PET), is that it is spark-protected due to the presence of, at least, one high-resistive electrode. However, the ohmic drop across the latter can affect the charge multiplication significantly. In this work, we investigate this effect in a RPC-like chamber. The counter was filled with nitrogen at atmospheric pressure and the primary ionization was produced by the incidence of nitrogen pulsed laser beam on an aluminum cathode. The illumination area of the cathode was measured using a foil of millimetric paper overlaid on this electrode. In this way, the resistance of the glass anode could be estimated using the known resistivity of the glass (ρ=2з1012 Ω.cm). Therefore, the voltage drop across the dielectric was calculated by the product of the current across the gas gap and the anode resistance. In order to mitigate the effect of the resistive electrode, the laser beam intensity was limited by interposing metallic meshes between the laser and the chamber window. The dependence of the ohmic drop from the applied voltage was analyzed. The results obtained shown that, without the meshes, the ohmic drop corresponds up to 7% of the applied voltage, preventing the detection system to reach values of density normalized electric fields in the gas gap (Eeff/N) higher than 166 Td. By minimizing the laser beam intensity and, consequently, the primary ionization, the ohmic drop represented only 0.2% of the applied voltage, extending the Eeff /N range up to 175 Td.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Studies of Gaseous Multiplication Coefficient in Isobutane
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Studies of Gaseous Multiplication Coefficient in Isobutane

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XXXII BRAZILIAN WORKSHOP ON NUCLEAR PHYSICS

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Mщtodos Experimentais e Instrumentaчуo para Partэculas Elementares e Fэsica Nuclear

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Processos de Colisуo e Interaчѕes de Сtomos e Molщculas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This work presents the studies of gaseous multiplication coefficient behavior for isobutane, as function of the reduced electric field, by means of signal amplitude analysis. The experimental method used is based on the Pulsed Townsend technique, which follows from Townsend equation solution for a uniform electric field. In our configuration, the anode is made of a high resistivity (2.10(12) Omega.cm) glass, while the cathode is of aluminium. In order to validate the technique and to analyze effects of non-uniformity, results for nitrogen, which has well established data available in literature, are also presented.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This work presents the studies of gaseous multiplication coefficient behavior for isobutane, as function of the reduced electric field, by means of signal amplitude analysis. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Persistence of odd-even staggering in charged-fragment yields from ^{112}Sn + ^{58}Ni collisions at 35 MeV/nucleon
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Persistence of odd-even staggering in charged-fragment yields from ^{112}Sn + ^{58}Ni collisions at 35 MeV/nucleon

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Odd-even staggering effects on charge distributions are investigated for fragments produced in semiperipheral and central collisions of Sn-112 + Ni-58 at 35 MeV/nucleon. For fragments with Z <= 16 one observes a clear overproduction of even charges, which decreases for heavier fragments. Staggering persists up to Z similar to 30. The staggering appears to be substantially independent of the centrality of the collisions, suggesting that it is mainly related to the last few steps in the decay of hot nuclei.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Odd-even staggering effects on charge distributions are investigated for fragments produced in semiperipheral and central collisions of Sn-112 + Ni-58 at 35 MeV/nucleon. For fragments with Z <= 16 one observes a clear overproduction of even charges, which decreases for heavier fragments. Staggering persists up to Z similar to 30. The staggering appears to be substantially independent of the centrality of the collisions, suggesting that it is mainly related to the last few steps in the decay of hot nuclei.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Inclusive dielectron spectra in p+p collisions at 3.5 GeV kinetic beam energy
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Inclusive dielectron spectra in p+p collisions at 3.5 GeV kinetic beam energy

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: European Physical Journal. A, Hadrons and Nuclei (Print)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We present the inclusive invariant mass, transverse momentum and rapidity distributions of dielectrons (e(+)e(-) pairs) in p+p interactions at 3.5 GeV beam kinetic energy. In the vector meson mass region, a distinct peak corresponding to direct omega decays is reconstructed with a 2% mass resolution. The data is compared to predictions from three model calculations. Due to the large acceptance of the HADES apparatus for e(+)e(-) invariant masses above 0.2 GeV/c(2) and for transverse pair momenta p(t) < 1 GeV/c, acceptance corrections are, to a large extent, model independent. This allows us to extract from dielectron data for the first time at this energy the inclusive production cross-sections for light vector mesons. Inclusive production cross-sections for pi(0) and eta mesons are also reported. The obtained results will serve as an important reference for the study of vector meson production in proton-nucleus and heavy-ion collisions. Furthermore, using this data, an improved value for the upper bound of the branching ratio for direct eta decays into the electron-positron channel is obtained.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: We present the inclusive invariant mass, transverse momentum and rapidity distributions of dielectrons (e(+)e(-) pairs) in p+p interactions at 3.5 GeV beam kinetic energy. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: First measurement of proton-induced low-momentum dielectron radiation off cold nuclear matter
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: First measurement of proton-induced low-momentum dielectron radiation off cold nuclear matter

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We present data on dielectron emission in proton induced reactions on a Nb target at 3.5 GeV kinetic beam energy measured with HADES installed at GSI. The data represent the first high statistics measurement of proton-induced dielectron radiation from cold nuclear matter in a kinematic regime, where strong medium effects are expected. Combined with the good mass resolution of 2%, it is the first measurement sensitive to changes of the spectral functions of vector mesons, as predicted by models for hadrons at rest or small relative momenta. Comparing the e(+)e(-) invariant mass spectra to elementary p + p data, we observe for e(+)e(-) momenta P-ee < 0.8 GeV/c a strong modification of the shape of the spectrum, which we attribute to an additional rho-like contribution and a decrease of omega yield. These opposite trends are tentatively interpreted as a strong coupling of the rho meson to baryonic resonances and an absorption of the omega meson, which are two aspects of in-medium modification of vector mesons.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: We present data on dielectron emission in proton induced reactions on a Nb target at 3.5 GeV kinetic beam energy measured with HADES installed at GSI. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: The HADES-at-FAIR project
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: The HADES-at-FAIR project

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: After the completion of the experimental program at SIS18 the HADES setup will migrate to FAIR, where it will deliver high-quality data for heavy-ion collisions in an unexplored energy range of up to 8 A GeV. In this contribution, we briefly present the physics case, relevant detector characteristics and discuss the recently completed upgrade of HADES.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Production of in reactions at 3.5 GeV beam energy
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Production of in reactions at 3.5 GeV beam energy

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We study the production of Sigma(+/-)pi(-/+)-pK(+) particle quartets in p + p reactions at 3.5 GeV kinetic beam energy. The data were taken with the HADES experiment at GSI. This report evaluates the contribution of resonances like Lambda(1405), Sigma(1385)(0), Lambda(1520), Delta(1232), N* and K*(0) to the Sigma(+/-)pi(-/+)pK(+) final state. The resulting simulation model is compared to the experimental data in several angular distributions and it shows itself as suitable to evaluate the acceptance corrections properly.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Processos de Colisуo e Interaчѕes de Сtomos e Molщculas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In this work we present results of the first Townsend coefficient (alpha) in pure isobutane by measuring the current growth as a function of the electric field strength in a pulsed irradiation regime. A Resistive Plate Chamber (RPC)-like configuration was used. To validate this method, as well as to crosscheck the experimental apparatus, measurements of the alpha parameter were firstly carried out with pure nitrogen and the results compared to the accurate data available in the literature. The data obtained with isobutane in a field range from 145 Td up to 200 Td were well-matched to those calculated with Magboltz versions 2.7.1 and 2.8.6. The experimental consistency of these results with other published data in the range of 550-1300 Td was very good, as demonstrated by the use of the Korff parameterization.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: In this work we present results of the first Townsend coefficient (alpha) in pure isobutane by measuring the current growth as a function of the electric field strength in a pulsed irradiation regime. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Baryonic resonances close to the K[over Џ]N threshold: The case of Σ(1385)^{+} in pp collisions
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Baryonic resonances close to the K[over Џ]N threshold: The case of Σ(1385)^{+} in pp collisions

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We present results of an exclusive measurement of the first-excited state of the Sigma hyperon, Sigma(1385)(+), produced in p + p -> Sigma(+) + K+ + n at 3.5 GeV beam energy. The extracted data allow the detailed study of the invariant mass distribution of the Sigma(1385)(+). The mass distribution is well described by a relativistic Breit-Wigner function with a maximum at m(0) = 1383.2 +/- 0.9 MeV/c(2) and a width of 40.2 +/- 2.1 MeV/c(2). The exclusive production cross section comes out to be 22.27 +/- 0.89 +/- 1.56(-2.10)(+3.07) mu b. Angular distributions of the Sigma(1385)(+) in different reference frames are found to be compatible with the hypothesis that 33% of Sigma(1385)(+) result from the decay of an intermediate broad Delta(++) excitation at about 2000 MeV/c(2).
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: We present results of an exclusive measurement of the first-excited state of the Sigma hyperon, Sigma(1385)(+), produced in p + p -> Sigma(+) + K+ + n at 3.5 GeV beam energy. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Direct Measurement of the Formation Length of Photons
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Direct Measurement of the Formation Length of Photons

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Fэsica das Partэculas Elementares e Campos
AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Geral de Partэculas e Campos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We report the first observation of a shoulder in the radiation spectrum from GeV electrons in a structured target consisting of two thin and closely spaced foils. The position of the shoulder depends on the target spacing and is directly connected to the finite formation length of a low-energy photon emitted by an ultrarelativistic electron. With the present setup it is possible to control the separation of the foils on a mu m scale and hence measure interference effects caused by the macroscopic dimensions of the formation length. Several theoretical groups have predicted this effect using different methods. Our observations have a preference for the modified theory by Blankenbecler but disagree with the results of Baier and Katkov.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: We report the first observation of a shoulder in the radiation spectrum from GeV electrons in a structured target consisting of two thin and closely spaced foils. The position of the shoulder depends on the target spacing and is directly connected to the finite formation length of a low-energy photon emitted by an ultrarelativistic electron. With the present setup it is possible to control the separation of the foils on a mu m scale and hence measure interference effects caused by the macroscopic dimensions of the formation length. Several theoretical groups have predicted this effect using different methods. Our observations have a preference for the modified theory by Blankenbecler but disagree with the results of Baier and Katkov.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Fэsica das Partэculas Elementares e Campos
AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teorias Especэficas e Modelos de Interaчуo; Sistemсtica de Partэculas; Raios Cѓsmicos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A computer code for Monte-Carlo simulations in the framework of the GEANT 3 toolkit has been implemented for the description of the discrete bremsstrahlung radiation from high energy electrons crossing thick (semi-infinite) targets. The code is based on the Migdal theory which includes the LPM and dielectric suppression. Validation of the code has been performed by a comparison with the data from the SLAC E-146 experiment. The agreement between simulations and experimental data is generally very good.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: A computer code for Monte-Carlo simulations in the framework of the GEANT 3 toolkit has been implemented for the description of the discrete bremsstrahlung radiation from high energy electrons crossing thick (semi-infinite) targets. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Dielectron production in Ar + KCl collisions at 1.76A GeV
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Dielectron production in Ar + KCl collisions at 1.76A GeV

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We present results on dielectron production in (40)Ar + KCl collisions at 1.76A GeV. For the first time. mesons could be reconstructed in a heavy-ion reaction at a bombarding energy which is well below the production threshold in free nucleon-nucleon collisions. The. multiplicity has been extracted and compared to the yields of other particles, in particular of the phi meson. At intermediate e(+) e(-) invariant masses, we find a strong enhancement of the pair yield over a reference spectrum from elementary nucleon-nucleon reactions, suggesting the onset of nontrivial effects of the nuclear medium. Transverse-mass spectra and angular distributions have been reconstructed in three invariant mass bins. In the former unexpectedly large slopes are found for high-mass pairs. The latter, in particular the helicity-angle distributions, are largely consistent with expectations for a pair cocktail dominated at intermediate masses by Delta Dalitz decays.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Secondary effects on electron multiplication in pure isobutane
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Secondary effects on electron multiplication in pure isobutane

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION A-ACCELERATORS SPECTROMETERS DETECTORS AND ASSOCIATED EQUIPMENT

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Mщtodos Experimentais e Instrumentaчуo para Partэculas Elementares e Fэsica Nuclear

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Processos de Colisуo e Interaчѕes de Сtomos e Molщculas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The presence of secondary processes in electron multiplication under high uniform electric fields at atmospheric pressure in pure isobutane was investigated. The experimental setup consists of a Resistive Plate Chamber-like cell with the anode made of a high resistivity glass (2 x 10(12) Omega cm) and a metallic cathode, on which photoelectrons are produced by the incidence of a pulsed laser beam. In particular, the dependence of the first Townsend coefficient (alpha) on the repetition rate and the intensity of the UV laser pulses was studied. The E/N range considered spanned from approximate to 145 to approximate to 200 Td. The alpha coefficient was determined by measuring both the primary ionization and the avalanche currents with the help of an electrometer, directly connected to the cathode. Of all the investigated secondary effects, only the ohmic drop across the resistive glass has been found to be non-negligible in the present experimental conditions and has been corrected for. The obtained values are compared with Magboltz simulation results and presented in tabular form.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Comparison of analytical and Monte Carlo calculations of multi-photon effects in bremsstrahlung emission by high-energy electrons

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Approximate analytical calculations of multi-photon effects in the spectrum of total radiated energy by high-energy electrons crossing thin targets are compared to the results of Monte Carlo type simulations. The limits of validity of the analytical expressions found in the literature are established. The separate contributions to spectral distortion of electromagnetic processes other than bremsstrahlung are also studied in detail.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Experimental investigations of synchrotron radiation at the onset of the quantum regime
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Experimental investigations of synchrotron radiation at the onset of the quantum regime

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Physical Review. D, Particles, Fields, Gravitation, and Cosmology

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Fэsica das Partэculas Elementares e Campos
AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teorias Especэficas e Modelos de Interaчуo; Sistemсtica de Partэculas; Raios Cѓsmicos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The classical description of synchrotron radiation fails at large Lorentz factors, gamma, for relativistic electrons crossing strong transverse magnetic fields B. In the rest frame of the electron this field is comparable to the so-called critical field B-0 = 4.414 x 10(9) T. For chi = gamma B/B-0 similar or equal to 1 quantum corrections are essential for the description of synchrotron radiation to conserve energy. With electrons of energies 10-150 GeV penetrating a germanium single crystal along the < 110 > axis, we have experimentally investigated the transition from the regime where classical synchrotron radiation is an adequate description, to the regime where the emission drastically changes character; not only in magnitude, but also in spectral shape. The spectrum can only be described by quantum synchrotron radiation formulas. Apart from being a test of strong-field quantum electrodynamics, the experimental results are also relevant for the design of future linear colliders where beamstrahlung-a closely related process-may limit the achievable luminosity.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The classical description of synchrotron radiation fails at large Lorentz factors, gamma, for relativistic electrons crossing strong transverse magnetic fields B. In the rest frame of the electron this field is comparable to the so-called critical field B-0 = 4.414 x 10(9) T. For chi = gamma B/B-0 similar or equal to 1 quantum corrections are essential for the description of synchrotron radiation to conserve energy. With electrons of energies 10-150 GeV penetrating a germanium single crystal along the < 110 > axis, we have experimentally investigated the transition from the regime where classical synchrotron radiation is an adequate description, to the regime where the emission drastically changes character; not only in magnitude, but also in spectral shape. The spectrum can only be described by quantum synchrotron radiation formulas. Apart from being a test of strong-field quantum electrodynamics, the experimental results are also relevant for the design of future linear colliders where beamstrahlung-a closely related process-may limit the achievable luminosity.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Deep sub-threshold K*(892)0 production in collisions of Ar + KCl at 1.76 A GeV
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Deep sub-threshold K*(892)0 production in collisions of Ar + KCl at 1.76 A GeV

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: European Physical Journal. A, Hadrons and Nuclei (Print)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Results on the deep sub-threshold production of the short-lived hadronic resonance K*(892)(0) are reported for collisions of Ar + KCl at 1.76 A GeV beam energy, studied with the High Acceptance Di-Electron Spectrometer (HADES) at SIS18/GSI. The K*(892)(0) production probability per central collision of P-K*0 = (4.4 +/- 1.1 +/- 0.5) x 10(-4) and the K*(892)(0)/K-0 ratio of P-K*0/P-K0 = (1.9 +/- 0.5 +/- 0.3) x 10(-2) are determined at the lowest energy so far (i.e. deep below the threshold for the corresponding production in nucleon-nucleon collisions, root s(NN)-root s(thr) = -340MeV). The K*(0)/K-0 ratio is compared with results of other experiments and with the predictions of the UrQMD transport approach and of the statistical hadronization model. The experimental K*(0) yield and the K-*0/K-0 ratio are overestimated by the transport model by factors of about five and two, respectively. In a chemically equilibrated medium the ratio corresponds to a temperature of the thermalized system being systematically lower than the value determined by the yields of the stable and long-lived hadrons produced in Ar + KCl collisions. From the present measurement, we conclude that sub-threshold K* production either cannot be considered to proceed in a system being in thermal equilibrium or these short-lived resonances appear undersaturated, for example as a result of the rescattering of the decay particles in the ambient hadronic medium.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Baryonic resonances close to the K[over Џ]N threshold: The case of -(1405) in pp collisions
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Baryonic resonances close to the K[over Џ]N threshold: The case of -(1405) in pp collisions

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We present an analysis of the Lambda(1405) resonance produced in the reaction p + p -> Sigma(+/-) + pi(-/+) + K+ + p at 3.5 GeV kinetic beam energy measured with the High Acceptance Dielectron Spectrometer (HADES) at the Gesellschaft fur Schwerionenforschung (GSI). The two charged decay channels Lambda (1405) -> Sigma(+/-) + pi(-/+) have been reconstructed for the first time in p + p collisions. The efficiency and acceptance- corrected spectral shapes show a peak position clearly below 1400MeV/c(2). We find a total production cross section of sigma(Lambda(1405)) = (1405) = 9.2 +/- 0.9 +/- 0.7(-1.0)(+3.3)mu b. The analysis of its polar angle distribution suggests that the Lambda(1405) is produced isotropically in the p - p center-of-mass system (CMS).
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: We present an analysis of the Lambda(1405) resonance produced in the reaction p + p -> Sigma(+/-) + pi(-/+) + K+ + p at 3.5 GeV kinetic beam energy measured with the High Acceptance Dielectron Spectrometer (HADES) at the Gesellschaft fur Schwerionenforschung (GSI). DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: pp and ππ intensity interferometry in collisions of Ar+KCl at 1.76A GeV
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: pp and ππ intensity interferometry in collisions of Ar+KCl at 1.76A GeV

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: European Physical Journal. A, Hadrons and Nuclei (Print)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Results on pp, pi(+) pi(+), and pi-pi-intensity interferometry are reported for collisions of Ar+KCl at 1.76A GeV beam energy, studied with the High Acceptance Di-Electron Spectrometer (HADES) at SIS18/GSI. The experimental correlation functions as a function of the relative momentum are compared to model calculations allowing the determination of the space-time extent of the corresponding emission sources. The pp source radii are found significantly larger than the pp emission radius. The present radii do well complement the beam-energy dependences of Gaussian source radii of the collision system of size A + A similar or equal to 40 + 40. The pp source radius at fixed beam energy is found to increase linearly with the cube root of the number of participants. From this trend, a lower limit of the pp correlation radius is deduced.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Results on pp, pi(+) pi(+), and pi-pi-intensity interferometry are reported for collisions of Ar+KCl at 1.76A GeV beam energy, studied with the High Acceptance Di-Electron Spectrometer (HADES) at SIS18/GSI. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: DILEPTON PRODUCTION STUDIED WITH THE HADES SPECTROMETER
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: DILEPTON PRODUCTION STUDIED WITH THE HADES SPECTROMETER

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: International Journal of Modern Physics A

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: With the HADES spectrometer at GSI we have studied dilepton production in various collision systems from elementary N+N, over p+A, up to the medium-heavy Ar+KCl system. We have confirmed the puzzling results of the former DLS collaboration at the Bevalac. While we have traced the origin of the excess pair yield in C+C collisions to elementary p+p and n+p processes, we find a significant contribution from the dense phase of the collision in larger Ar+KCl system. From recently obtained e(+)e(-) pair spectra in p+p and p+Nb interactions at 3.5 GeV kinetic beam energy the inclusive production cross sections for neutral pions, eta, omega and rho mesons are extracted for the first time at this beam energy. Furthermore, the production mechanisms of the vector mesons, which are not known at these energies, are investigated. The direct comparison of p+p and p+Nb data allows us to investigate in-medium mass modifications of vector mesons at nuclear ground state density. On the other hand, exclusive production of omega and eta mesons in p+p reactions at 3.5 GeV were studied via their pi(+)pi(-)pi(0) decay channel. Production cross sections and angular distributions for both states were determined.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: With the HADES spectrometer at GSI we have studied dilepton production in various collision systems from elementary N+N, over p+A, up to the medium-heavy Ar+KCl system. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Hyperon production in Ar + KCl collisions at 1.76A GeV
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Hyperon production in Ar + KCl collisions at 1.76A GeV

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: European Physical Journal. A, Hadrons and Nuclei (Print)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We present transverse momentum spectra, rapidity distribution and multiplicity of Lambda-hyperons measured with the HADES spectrometer in the reaction Ar(1.76A GeV) + KCl. The yield of Xi(-) is calculated from our previously reported Xi(-)/(Lambda+Sigma(0)) ratio and compared to other strange particle multiplicities. Employing a strangeness balance equation the multiplicities of the yet unmeasured Sigma(+/-)-hyperons can be estimated. Finally a statistical hadronization model is used to fit the yields of pi(-), K(+), K(s)(0), K(-), phi, Lambda and Xi(-). The resulting chemical freeze-out temperature of T = (76 +/- 2) MeV is compared to the measured slope parameters obtained from fits to the transverse mass distributions of the different particles.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: In-medium effects on K^{0} mesons in relativistic heavy-ion collisions
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: In-medium effects on K^{0} mesons in relativistic heavy-ion collisions

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We present the transverse momentum spectra and rapidity distributions of pi(-) and K-S(0) in Ar + KCl reactions at a beam kinetic energy of 1.756 A GeV measured with the High Acceptance Di-Electron Spectrometer (HADES). The reconstructed K-S(0) sample is characterized by good event statistics for a wide range in momentum and rapidity. We compare the experimental pi(-) and K-S(0) distributions to predictions by the Isospin Quantum Molecular Dynamics (IQMD) model. The model calculations show that K-S(0) at low transverse momenta constitute a particularly well-suited tool to investigate the kaon in-medium potential. Our K-S(0) data suggest a strong repulsive in-medium K-0 potential of about 40 MeV strength.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: We present the transverse momentum spectra and rapidity distributions of pi(-) and K-S(0) in Ar + KCl reactions at a beam kinetic energy of 1.756 A GeV measured with the High Acceptance Di-Electron Spectrometer (HADES). Our K-S(0) data suggest a strong repulsive in-medium K-0 potential of about 40 MeV strength.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Experimental investigation of strong field trident production

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Fэsica das Partэculas Elementares e Campos
AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teorias Especэficas e Modelos de Interaчуo; Sistemсtica de Partэculas; Raios Cѓsmicos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We show by experiment that an electron impinging on an electric field that is of critical magnitude in its rest frame, may produce an electron-positron pair. Our measurements address higher-order QED, using the strong electric fields obtainable along particular crystallographic directions in single crystals. For the amorphous material our data are in good agreement with theory, whereas a discrepancy with theory on the magnitude of the trident enhancement is found in the precisely aligned case where the strong electric field acts.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: We show by experiment that an electron impinging on an electric field that is of critical magnitude in its rest frame, may produce an electron-positron pair. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: --p femtoscopy in collisions of Ar+KCl at 1.76A-GeV
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: --p femtoscopy in collisions of Ar+KCl at 1.76A-GeV

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Results on Lambda p femtoscopy are reported at the lowest energy so far. At a beam energy of 1.76AGeV, the reaction Ar + KCl was studied with the High Acceptance Di-Electron Spectrometer ( HADES) at SIS18/GSI. A high-statistics and high-purity Lambda sample was collected, allowing for the investigation of Lambda p correlations at low relative momenta. The experimental correlation function is compared to corresponding model calculations allowing the determination of the space-time extent of the Lambda p emission source. The Lambda p source radius is found to be slightly smaller than the pp correlation radius for a similar collision system. The present Lambda p radius is significantly smaller than that found for Au + Au/Pb + Pb collisions in the AGS, SPS, and RHIC energy domains but larger than that observed for electroproduction from He. Taking into account all available data, we find the Lambda p source radius to increase almost linearly with the number of participants to the power of one-third.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Results on Lambda p femtoscopy are reported at the lowest energy so far. At a beam energy of 1.76AGeV, the reaction Ar + KCl was studied with the High Acceptance Di-Electron Spectrometer ( HADES) at SIS18/GSI. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Origin of the low-mass electron pair excess in light nucleus-nucleus collisions
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Origin of the low-mass electron pair excess in light nucleus-nucleus collisions

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We report measurements of electron pair production in elementary p + p and d + p reactions at 1.25 GeV/mu with the HADES spectrometer. For the first time, the electron pairs were reconstructed for n + p reactions by detecting the proton spectator from the deuteron breakup. We find that the yield of electron pairs with invariant mass M(e+e)- > 0.15 GeV/c(2) is about an order of magnitude larger in n + p reactions as compared to p + p. A comparison to model calculations demonstrates that the production mechanism is not sufficiently described yet. The electron pair spectra measured in C + C reactions are compatible with a superposition of elementary n + p and p + p collisions, leaving little room for additional electron pair sources in such light collision systems.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: We report measurements of electron pair production in elementary p + p and d + p reactions at 1.25 GeV/mu with the HADES spectrometer. For the first time, the electron pairs were reconstructed for n + p reactions by detecting the proton spectator from the deuteron breakup. We find that the yield of electron pairs with invariant mass M(e+e)- > 0.15 GeV/c(2) is about an order of magnitude larger in n + p reactions as compared to p + p. A comparison to model calculations demonstrates that the production mechanism is not sufficiently described yet. The electron pair spectra measured in C + C reactions are compatible with a superposition of elementary n + p and p + p collisions, leaving little room for additional electron pair sources in such light collision systems.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Restricted energy loss of ultrarelativistic particles in thin targets - A search for deviations from constancy
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Restricted energy loss of ultrarelativistic particles in thin targets - A search for deviations from constancy

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Nuclear Instruments & Methods in Physics Research. Section B, Beam Interactions with Materials and Atoms (Print)

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Fэsica das Partэculas Elementares e Campos
AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teorias Especэficas e Modelos de Interaчуo; Sistemсtica de Partэculas; Raios Cѓsmicos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Experimental results for the restricted energy loss of ultrarelativistic electrons, with Lorentz factors up to 3 x 10(5), in a 535 mu m thin silicon detector are presented. The combination of high Lorentz factors and thin targets, opens for the possibility to study two mutually excluding effects, both based upon theory and on scarce experimental observations. One is a disappearance of the density effect when the transit time becomes so short that the effect of plasma-oscillations becomes negligible. This would result in an increased energy loss as the Lorentz factor increases. The other is an effect based on the existence of a coherence length over which there are contributions to the energy loss. This effect leads to a substantially decreased energy loss for thin targets as the Lorentz factor increases. The latter is shown to be incompatible with our measurements, whereas the former may be present with a correction of a few percent to an otherwise constant energy loss. Furthermore, we point to significant effects related to synchrotron and transition radiation, that must be carefully considered in a possible future experiment, and may as well have been of significance for the conclusion in earlier experiments.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Dilepton Production at SIS Energies Studied with HADES
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Dilepton Production at SIS Energies Studied with HADES

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: One of the main goals of the HADES experiment is to achieve a detailed understanding of dielectron emission from hadronic systems at moderate bombarding energies. Results obtained on electron pair production in elementary N+N collisions pave the way to a better understanding of the origin of the pair excess seen in heavy-ion collisions. This puzzling excess, reported first by the former DLS experiment, is now being investigated systematically by HADES.
